title: Navassa Island
summary: Navassa Island (/nəˈvæsə/; French: l'île de la Navasse; also La Navasse, La Navase; Haitian Creole: Lanavaz) is a small uninhabited island in the Caribbean Sea. Located northeast of Jamaica, south of Cuba, and 40 nautical miles (74 km; 46 mi) west of Jérémie on the Tiburon Peninsula of Haiti, it is subject to an ongoing territorial dispute between Haiti and the United States, which administers the island through the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service.[1]
